it.unipr.netsec.ipstack.analyzer

Class LibpcapHeader

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.unipr.netsec.ipstack.analyzer.LibpcapHeader

  • public class LibpcapHeader
extends java.lang.Object
    Libpcap Global Header. The header starts libpcap files and is followed by the sequence of libpcap packet records.

    The header specifies the file format version (current version is 2.4), the time zone, the accuracy of timestamps, the length of captured packets, and the type of link.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int LINKTYPE_BLUETOOTH_HCI_H4

      static int LINKTYPE_ETHERNET
      IEEE 802.3 Ethernet (10Mb, 100Mb, 1000Mb, and up).
      static int LINKTYPE_IEEE802_11
      IEEE 802.11 wireless LAN.
      static int LINKTYPE_IPV4
      Raw IPv4.
      static int LINKTYPE_IPV6
      Raw IPv6.
      static int LINKTYPE_LAPB_WITH_DIR
      Link Access Procedure, Balanced (LAPB), as specified by ITU-T Recommendation X.25, preceded with a one-byte pseudo-header with a zero value meaning "received by this host" (DCE-DTE) and a non-zero value meaning "sent by this host" (DTE-DCE).
      static int LINKTYPE_LOOP
      OpenBSD loopback encapsulation.
      static int LINKTYPE_NULL
      BSD loopback encapsulation.
      static int LINKTYPE_PPP
      DLT_PPP PPP, as per RFC 1661 and RFC 1662.
      static int LINKTYPE_PPP_ETHER
      PPPoE; the packet begins with a PPPoE header, as per RFC 2516.
      static int LINKTYPE_PPP_HDLC
      PPP in HDLC-like framing, as per RFC 1662, or Cisco PPP with HDLC framing, as per section 4.3.1 of RFC 1547.
      static int LINKTYPE_RAW
      Raw IP.
      static int LINKTYPE_SLIP
      SLIP, encapsulated with a LINKTYPE_SLIP header.
      static int LINKTYPE_USB_LINUX
      USB packets, beginning with a Linux USB header, as specified by the struct usbmon_packet in the Documentation/usb/usbmon.txt file in the Linux source tree.

    • Field Detail

      • LINKTYPE_NULL

        public static final int LINKTYPE_NULL
        BSD loopback encapsulation. The link layer header is a 4-byte field, in host byte order, containing a value of 2 for IPv4 packets, a value of either 24, 28, or 30 for IPv6 packets, a value of 7 for OSI packets, or a value of 23 for IPX packets. All of the IPv6 values correspond to IPv6 packets; code reading files should check for all of them.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LINKTYPE_ETHERNET

        public static final int LINKTYPE_ETHERNET
        IEEE 802.3 Ethernet (10Mb, 100Mb, 1000Mb, and up).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LINKTYPE_SLIP

        public static final int LINKTYPE_SLIP
        SLIP, encapsulated with a LINKTYPE_SLIP header.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LINKTYPE_PPP

        public static final int LINKTYPE_PPP
        DLT_PPP PPP, as per RFC 1661 and RFC 1662. If the first 2 bytes are 0xff and 0x03, it's PPP in HDLC-like framing, with the PPP header following those two bytes, otherwise it's PPP without framing, and the packet begins with the PPP header.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LINKTYPE_PPP_HDLC

        public static final int LINKTYPE_PPP_HDLC
        PPP in HDLC-like framing, as per RFC 1662, or Cisco PPP with HDLC framing, as per section 4.3.1 of RFC 1547. The first byte will be 0xFF for PPP in HDLC-like framing, and will be 0x0F or 0x8F for Cisco PPP with HDLC framing.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LINKTYPE_PPP_ETHER

        public static final int LINKTYPE_PPP_ETHER
        PPPoE; the packet begins with a PPPoE header, as per RFC 2516.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LINKTYPE_RAW

        public static final int LINKTYPE_RAW
        Raw IP. The packet begins with an IPv4 or IPv6 header, with the "version" field of the header indicating whether it's an IPv4 or IPv6 header.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LINKTYPE_IEEE802_11

        public static final int LINKTYPE_IEEE802_11
        IEEE 802.11 wireless LAN.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LINKTYPE_LOOP

        public static final int LINKTYPE_LOOP
        OpenBSD loopback encapsulation. The link-layer header is a 4-byte field, in network byte order, containing a value of 2 for IPv4 packets, a value of either 24, 28, or 30 for IPv6 packets, a value of 7 for OSI packets, or a value of 23 for IPX packets. All of the IPv6 values correspond to IPv6 packets; code reading files should check for all of them.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LINKTYPE_BLUETOOTH_HCI_H4

        public static final int LINKTYPE_BLUETOOTH_HCI_H4
        Bluetooth HCI UART transport layer. The frame contains an HCI packet indicator byte, as specified by the UART Transport Layer portion of the most recent Bluetooth Core specification, followed by an HCI packet of the specified packet type, as specified by the Host Controller Interface Functional Specification portion of the most recent Bluetooth Core Specification.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LINKTYPE_USB_LINUX

        public static final int LINKTYPE_USB_LINUX
        USB packets, beginning with a Linux USB header, as specified by the struct usbmon_packet in the Documentation/usb/usbmon.txt file in the Linux source tree. Only the first 48 bytes of that header are present. All fields in the header are in host byte order. When performing a live capture, the host byte order is the byte order of the machine on which the packets are captured. When reading a pcap file, the byte order is the byte order for the file, as specified by the file's magic number; when reading a pcapng file, the byte order is the byte order for the section of the pcapng file, as specified by the Section Header Block.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LINKTYPE_LAPB_WITH_DIR

        public static final int LINKTYPE_LAPB_WITH_DIR
        Link Access Procedure, Balanced (LAPB), as specified by ITU-T Recommendation X.25, preceded with a one-byte pseudo-header with a zero value meaning "received by this host" (DCE-DTE) and a non-zero value meaning "sent by this host" (DTE-DCE).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LINKTYPE_IPV4

        public static final int LINKTYPE_IPV4
        Raw IPv4. The packet begins with an IPv4 header.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LINKTYPE_IPV6

        public static final int LINKTYPE_IPV6
        Raw IPv6. The packet begins with an IPv6 header.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values
